questions: What is the Regional Educational Services Division?
What does RES stand for at the Open University of Sri Lanka?
What does Regional Educational Services (RES) stand for at OUSL?
What does the Regional Educational Services Division do?
Who manages the Regional and Study Centres at OUSL?
How many Regional Centres does OUSL have?
How many Study Centres does OUSL operate?
What does the Regional Educational Services Division do at OUSL?
Who ensures ODL programs are delivered across Sri Lanka?
Who supports student learning outside the main campus?
How does OUSL manage decentralized student services?
What is the role of the RES Division in distance learning?
Who coordinates OUSL's study network across Sri Lanka?
Who supports students through Regional and Study Centres?
How is distance learning delivered to students nationwide?
Who handles academic and administrative services in the regions?
What division looks after ODL students across Sri Lanka?
answer: The Regional Educational Services (RES) Division coordinates academic and administrative support through nine Regional Centres and nineteen Study Centres across Sri Lanka. It ensures effective delivery of Open and Distance Learning (ODL) programs and facilitates student learning through decentralized services. (https://ou.ac.lk/res/)

questions: What are the Regional Centres of OUSL?
How many Regional Centres are there?
Where are the OUSL Regional Centres located?
Can you name the nine OUSL Regional Centres?
Does OUSL have centres outside Colombo?
What services are offered at OUSL Regional Centres?
Can students register or do exams at Regional Centres?
Do the Regional Centres have library services?
What academic activities take place at these centres?
Can students get counselling at OUSL centres?
Where can I access OUSL services outside the main campus?
Which cities have Open University Regional Centres?
Can I study or take exams at a Regional Centre?
Where can students go for academic support in Sri Lanka?
Who provides registration and academic help regionally for OUSL?
answer: The Open University of Sri Lanka operates nine Regional Centres: Colombo, Kandy, Matara, Anuradhapura, Batticaloa, Kurunegala, Badulla, Jaffna, and Ratnapura. These centres provide key academic services including registration, counselling, academic activities, library services, and examinations. (https://ou.ac.lk/centres/)

questions: What is a Study Centre at OUSL?
What are OUSL Study Centres?
How is a Study Centre different from a Regional Centre?
What happens at a Study Centre?
Where can students access Study Centres?
What services do Study Centres provide?
Do Study Centres help students in rural areas?
Can I get academic counselling at a Study Centre?
Can I attend tutorials or practicals at a Study Centre?
Do Study Centres provide library and LMS access?
Can I submit assignments at a Study Centre?
What student support is available at Study Centres?
Where can I study if I live far from a Regional Centre?
Who helps students in rural and suburban areas?
Can I use a Study Centre for online learning help?
Are Study Centres part of the Open University network?
What's the purpose of OUSL Study Centres?
answer: Study Centres operate under Regional Centres and provide localized student services. These include support for academic counseling, tutorials, practical sessions, library access, assignment submission, and LMS-related help. Study Centres improve educational accessibility in suburban and rural areas. (https://ou.ac.lk/centres/)

questions: Who manages the Regional Educational Services Division?
Who manages OUSL's Regional and Study Centres?
Who is responsible for Regional Services operations?
Who leads Regional Educational Services?
Who is the Director of Regional Educational Services at OUSL?
What does the Director of  Regional Educational Services do?
Who oversees academic and operational activities across all OUSL centres?
Who is responsible for student support services in all regions?
What are the duties of the Director of Regional Educational Services?
Who ensures Regional and Study Centres meet university goals?
Who manages the coordination between the centres and OUSL headquarters?
Who maintains the quality of support services for students?
What role does the Director of RES play in distance education delivery?
Who runs OUSL's student support network across Sri Lanka?
Who ensures consistency across all Regional and Study Centres?
Who is responsible for aligning centre activities with OUSL's mission?
Who oversees the academic operations outside the main campus?
Who looks after the smooth functioning of OUSL centres?
answer: The Director of Regional Educational Services is responsible for managing academic and operational coordination of all Regional and Study Centres, ensuring alignment with the university's goals and maintaining the quality of student support services. (https://ou.ac.lk/res/)

questions: What services are available at Regional or Study Centres?
What services do OUSL Regional and Study Centres offer?
Can I register or get course material at these centres?
Are exams held at these centres?
What can students do at OUSL centres?
What facilities are available at the Regional and Study Centres?
What support can I get at a Study Centre or Regional Centre?
Are registration and exams handled at OUSL centres?
Can I get my learning materials from a Regional Centre?
Do Regional Centres conduct day schools and labs?
Can I submit assignments at a Study Centre?
Are library and counselling services available at the centres?
Do these centres organize examinations for students?
How do OUSL centres help students?
Can I get both academic and administrative support at a centre?
What activities happen at Study Centres?
Where can I attend practical or lab sessions as a distance learner?
What student services are available outside the main campus?
answer: Regional and Study Centres provide a wide range of services including registration, distribution of learning materials, academic and administrative support, counseling, library services, conducting day schools and laboratory sessions, assignment handling, and organizing examinations. (https://ou.ac.lk/res/)

answer: TContact information for the Regional Educational Services Division and each Regional/Study Centre is available on the official OUSL website. Students may reach out via telephone, email, or visit in person for academic or administrative assistance. (https://ou.ac.lk/contact-directory/)

questions: What is the role of Regional Educational Services in distance learning?
What is the purpose of the Regional Educational Services Division at OUSL?
How do Regional Services support ODL?
Why are Regional Centres important to students?
How does Regional Educational Services help students?
Why does OUSL have Regional and Study Centres?
What role does Regional Educational Services play in Open and Distance Learning?
How does Regional Educational Services support learners across Sri Lanka?
How does OUSL ensure education is accessible islandwide?
How does Regional Educational Services make learning inclusive?
Who brings academic services closer to students?
How does OUSL support students outside the main campus?
Why is RES important for distance learners?
How does OUSL reach students in rural areas?
Who makes learning more accessible for OUSL students?
Why does OUSL operate a network of centres?
How does Regional Educational Services keep students engaged?
How does Regional Educational Services help with outreach and support?
answer: Regional Educational Services enable equitable access to Open and Distance Learning by decentralizing academic services and bringing support closer to learners. Through its network of centres, RES enhances outreach, inclusivity, and continuous engagement for learners across the island. (https://ou.ac.lk/res/)
